recipe_long_name: Rice Ball Rasmalai recipe - How to make Rice Ball Rasmalai
ingredients:
For The Rice Balls:
 1 cup rice flour (chawal ka atta)
 1 tbsp oil
 1 tbsp milk
 5 tbsp condensed milk
 1/2 cup blanched and chopped pistachios
 For The Sauce:
 2 cups milk
 1/2 cup condensed milk
 5 tbsp powdered almonds (badam)
 For The Garnish:
 chopped mixed nuts
recipe:
For the rice balls
In a pan add water, oil, milk and when water warms up, add rice flour and keep stirring so that no lumps are formed.
Once this mixture starts to thicken and take dough consistency and the mixture leaves the sides of the pan.
Remove from heat and cool down mixture.
Add condensed milk, apply some oil on hand because dough is sticky  then make small balls and stuff one pista into balls.
Steam cook in a idli cooker for 10 minutes.
For the sauce
In a heavy bottomed pan, add milk, bring to boil add condensed milk and almond powder.
When the milk starts to thicken a little add rice balls  and cook for 3-4 minute.
Remove from heat and garnish with dry fruits and serve chilled.
tags:
Gujarati Sweet Mithai
Traditional Indian Rice Recipes
Traditional Indian Mithai
Diwali
Eid
Deep Pan
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 30 mins, Total Time: 40 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Navratri Special Khichdi recipe - How to make Navratri Special Khichdi
ingredients:
100 gms sago (sabudana)
 100 gms boiled and deep fried potato cubes
 50 gms roasted and crushed peanuts
 4 chopped green chillies
 15-20 curry leaves (kadi patta)
 1 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania)
 1 tsp lemon juice
 1/2 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 salt to taste
 1 tbsp ghee
 1 tbsp pomegranate (anar)
 1 tbsp chopped mixed fruits
 1 tsp sugar
recipe:
Method
Soak sabudana in water for 3 minutes, drain out water and keep sabunana with little water for 2 hours and keep aside.
Heat the ghee in a kadhai, add the cumin seeds, green chillies, curry leaves and saute for few seconds.
When the seeds crackle, add the soaked sabudana, groundnuts, fried potatoes, salt, lemon juice and sugar and mix well.
Transfer in a serving bowl and serve hot garnished with fruits and coriander.
tags:
Gujarati  Faral, Faraal
Quick breakfast
Indian Snacks for Entertaining
Evening Tea Snacks
Mahashivaratri
Navratri Vrat 
Non Stick Kadai Veg
times: Preparation Time: 20 mins, Cooking Time: 15 mins, Total Time: 35 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Crispy Stuffed Bread Rolls recipe - How to make Crispy Stuffed Bread Rolls
ingredients:
8 bread slices
 200 gms potatoes
 100 gms paneer (cottage cheese)
 4 chopped green chillies
 1 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania)
 oil for frying or shallow frying
 salt to taste
recipe:
Method
Boil potatoes and mash them well.
Add the paneer, green chillies, coriander and salt and mix well.
Divide the mixture into 8 equal portions and keep aside.
Dip 1 bread slice in water for 10 seconds and squeeze out excess water.
Put one part of the mxiture across on the bread and roll it on our palm.
Give shape like karelas, make all rolls and keep aside.
Heat the oil in a kadhai and deep fry the rolls till they turn golden brown and crisp from all the sides.
Serve hot with sauce and chutney.
tags:
Gujarati Farsans
Deep-fried Indian Starters

recipe_long_name: Anjeer and Dates Barfi recipe - How to make Anjeer and Dates Barfi
ingredients:
1 1/2 cups dried figs (anjeer)
 1 1/2 cups deseeded dates (khajur)
 10 to 12 almonds (badam)
 5 to 8 cashewnuts (kaju)
 10 pistachios
 1 tsp ghee
recipe:
Method
Cut dried figs in small pieces and add some water and microwave on high for 2 minute.
Make a puree using a little water if required.
Chop seedless dates in a microwave oven and microwave on high  for one minute and make a puree using a little water if required.
First roast almonds, cashewnuts and pistachios and than chop all the nuts in small pieces.
Grease a tray.
Heat ghee in a pan.
Add anjeer puree and dates puree and saute well and cook on medium heat, stirring continuously, for 5 minutes or till mixture leaves the side of  pan.
Add almonds, cashewnuts and pistachios.
Mix well for two minutes, stirring continuously.
Spread evenly on the greased tray.
Cover with dry fruit powder.
When cool, cut into pieces and serve.
tags:
Gujarati Sweet Mithai
Low Cal Sweets / Desserts
Janmashtami
Ganesh Chaturthi
Ekadashi Recipes, Ekadasi
Non-stick Pan
Non Stick Kadai Veg
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 10 mins, Total Time: 20 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Suva and Panneer Pancakes recipe - How to make Suva and Panneer Pancakes
ingredients:
For The Batter:
 1/2 cup moong (whole green gram) dal flour
 2 tbsp besan (bengal gram flour)
 salt to taste
 1 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 coriander (dhania) powder to taste
 2 tsp ginger (adrak) paste
 2 tsp green chilli paste
 2 tbsp chopped dill (shepu / suva bhaji)
 2 tsp oil
 For The Topping:
 2 tbsp chopped onions
 1/4 cup chopped paneer (cottage cheese)
 1/4 cup boiled sweet corn kernels (makai ke dane)
 salt and freshly ground black pepper (kalimirch) powder to taste
recipe:
For batter
Combine all the ingredients in a deep bowl and make a thin batter.
Heat tava hot.
Sprinkle water and wipe it.
Pour laddleful of batter on it and make 4" round.
Spread the topping on it and roast.
The base will turn brown and top will dry.
Sprinkle some oil on top and turn it over.
Roast it for a minute and turn.
Garnish it with carrot flower, one each in the center of the pancake and serve fresh with tea and chutney.
tags: Gujarati Farsans
times: Preparation Time: 5 mins, Cooking Time: 5 mins, Total Time: 10 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Moogar Ajwain Bhajiya recipe - How to make Moogar Ajwain Bhajiya
ingredients:
1/2 cup moong (whole green gram) dal flour
 salt to taste
 a pinch turmeric powder (haldi)
 a pinch baking soda
 1 tsp carom seeds (ajwain)
 1/2 cup sliced raw banana
 water to make batter
 oil for deep frying
recipe:
Method
Heat oil for deep frying.
Combine all the ingredients for batter in a deep bowl. Add soda and mix well.
Dip raw banana slices in it and deep fry until crisp  and evenly brown.
Drain and serve fresh.
tags: Gujarati Farsans
times: Preparation Time: 5 mins, Cooking Time: 5 mins, Total Time: 10 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Pan Leaf Bhajiyas recipe - How to make Pan Leaf Bhajiyas
ingredients:
1/2 cup besan (bengal gram flour)
 salt to taste
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1/2 tsp crushed cumin seeds (jeera)
 1/2 tsp freshly ground black pepper (kalimirch) powder
 1/2 tsp crushed fennel seeds (saunf)
 water to make the batter
 a pinch baking soda
 2 tsp hot oil
recipe:
Method
Combine all the ingredients in a deep bowl and make smooth semi thick batter using water. Add soda and mix well.
Heat oil for deep frying and drop small round bhajiyas in it. Deep fry untill crisp and brown.
Drain and serve hot.
tags: Gujarati Farsans
times: Preparation Time: 5 mins, Cooking Time: 5 mins, Total Time: 10 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Basundi (sweet Dish Of Gujarat) recipe - How to make Basundi (sweet Dish Of Gujarat)
ingredients:
4 liters_spell! milk
 1 cup sugar
 8-9 cardamom (elaichi)
 1 tsp chirongi nuts (charoli) nuts
 6 almonds (badam)
 5 drops lemon juice
recipe:
Method
Heat the milk in an iron kadai or saucepan.
When the milk thickens and becomes creamy, squeeze in the lemon juice.
The milk will become slightly granular, add sugar, and boil for 10 minute more.
Pour into a bowl and garnish with powdered cardamoms.
Serve chilled.
tags:
Gujarati Sweet Mithai
Indian Sorbets /  Indian Frozen Desserts

recipe_long_name: Salad with Papad recipe - How to make Salad with Papad
ingredients:
5 roasted papad cones
 To Be Mixed Together For The Salad:
 1/4 cup chopped spring onions
 1/2 tsp madras curry powder
 1 tbsp finely chopped celery
 2 tbsp chopped apple
 1 tbsp chopped green garlic (hara lehsun)
 1/4 cup finely chopped radish pods (mogri)
 2 tbsp chopped tomatoes
 2 tbsp chopped cucumber
 2 tsp lemon juice
 1 tsp roasted cumin seeds (jeera) powder
 salt to taste
 For The Garnish:
 2 tbsp crushed papad
 2 tbsp pomegranate (anar) seeds
recipe:
Method
Fill the papad  cones with salad just before serving.
Serve immediately garnished with crushed papad and pomegranate.
tags: Gujarati  Dry Snacks
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 0 mins , Total Time: 10 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Saunf Rice recipe - How to make Saunf Rice
ingredients:
1 cup soaked long grained rice (basmati)
 1/4 cup roasted fennel seeds (sauf) powder , tied in a muslin cloth
 salt to taste
 1 tbsp olive oil
 1 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 1 tsp coarsely crushed roasted fennel seeds (sauf) powder
 2 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania)
 roasted cashewnuts (kaju) for garnishing
recipe:
Method
Heat enough water in a deep pan, add the rice, fennel seeds tied in cloth and salt, mix well and cover and cook till the rice is cooked.
Remove the fennel seeds potli and discard. Keep aside covered.
Heat the oil in a pan and add the cumin seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the fennel seeds and cooked rice and mix well.
Add the coriander and mix lightly.
Serve immediately garnished with roasted cashewnuts.
tags:

recipe_long_name: Faraali Cucumber Raita recipe - How to make Faraali Cucumber Raita
ingredients:
3/4 cup grated cucumber , squeezed
 1 cup beaten curds (dahi)
 1 tsp grated ginger (adrak)
 2 tsp chopped green chillies
 salt to taste
 1/2 tsp powdered sugar
 2 tsp ghee
 2 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 a few curry leaves (kadi patta)
 2 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania)
 a few cashewnut (kaju)
 a few raisin
 2 tbsp roasted and crushed peanuts
recipe:
Method
Heat the ghee in a small pan and add the cumin seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the curry leaves, green chillies, ginger, cashew and raisins and saute for 2 minutes.
Add this tempering to the curds and mix well.
Add the salt, sugar, cucumber and coriander and peanut powder and mix well.
Serve immediately.
tags: Gujarati Kachumber / Chutneys / Achar
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 0 mins , Total Time: 10 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Fresh Lemon Juice with Herbs recipe - How to make Fresh Lemon Juice with Herbs
ingredients:
2 tbsp lemon juice
 2 tbsp powdered sugar
 1/2 tsp salt
 2 tbsp finely chopped basil
 1/4 tsp cardamom (elaichi) powder
 For The Garnish:
 thin lemon slices
recipe:
Method
Add the lemon juice, sugar, salt, cardamom powder and basil in chilled water and mix well.
Keep aside for half an hour in refrigerator.
Strain and serve chilled garnished with fresh lemon slices.

recipe_name: Srikhand with Kesari Milk Masala Powder
recipe_long_name: Srikhand with Kesari Milk Masala Powder recipe - How to make Srikhand with Kesari Milk Masala Powder
ingredients:
400 gms thick hung curds (chakka dahi)
 4 tbsp saffron (kesar) strands milk masala powder , readily available
 2 tbsp powdered sugar
 For The Garnish:
 saffron (kesar) strands strands
recipe:
Method
Whisk the curds and add the sugar and milk masala and mix well till the curd becomes smooth and fluffy.
Refrigerate for atleast half an hour and serve chilled garnished with saffron.
tags:
Gujarati Sweet Mithai
Traditional Indian Mithai
Quick Indian Sweets

recipe_long_name: Banana and Walnut Starter recipe - How to make Banana and Walnut Starter
ingredients:
1/2 cup bananas slices
 1/4 cup roasted chopped walnuts
 10  crisp puris ,  readily available
 1/4 cup boiled and mashed potatoes
 1/4 cup hung curds (chakka dahi)
 salt to taste
 2 tsp roasted cumin seeds (jeera) powder
 freshly ground black pepper powder to taste
 khajur imili ki chutney to taste
 For Garnish:
 grated carrot
 chopped coriander (dhania)
recipe:
Method
Add walnuts to the curds and mix well. Keep refrigerated till use.
Place the small puris on clean dry plate and spread the curds evenly on each puri.
Place the banana slices followed with potato.
Sprinkle the cumin seeds powder, salt and pepper and drop some chutney on it.
Place the carrots and coriander on top and serve immediately.
tags:
Gujarati Farsans
Indian Snacks using Fruits
Sweet Snacks
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 0 mins , Total Time: 10 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Divine Srikhand recipe - How to make Divine Srikhand
ingredients:
For Thandai Paste:
 6 cashewnuts (kaju)
 6 almonds (badam) , blanched and peeled
 13 blanched pistachios
 2 tbsp poppy seeds (khus-khus)
 2 tbsp fennel seeds (saunf)
 1/2 tsp nutmeg (jaiphal) powder
 1/2 tsp cardamom (elaichi) powder
 a few saffron (kesar) strands strands
 1 tsp white pepper powder
 1/4 cup warm milk
 For The Srikhand:
 2 cups hung curds (chakka dahi)
 4 tbsp powdered sugar
 To Garnish:
 sliced and blanched pistachios
recipe:
For thandai paste
Combine all the ingredients, mix well and keep aside till the nuts turn soft.
Blend in a mixer till smooth. Keep aside.
For the srikhand
Combine the curds add sugar in a bowl and mix well.
How to proceed
Add the thandai paste to the shrikhand and mix well.
Serve chilled garnished with pistachios.
tags: Gujarati Sweet Mithai
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 0 mins , Total Time: 10 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Divine Mango recipe - How to make Divine Mango
ingredients:
6 cups mango pulp
 6 tsp milk masala powder
 1/2 cup milk , optional
 To Garnish:
 a few saffron (kesar) strands strands
recipe:
Method
Combine the mango pulp and milk masala powder in a bowl, mix well and refrigerate till chilled.
Serve chilled garnished with saffron strands.
tags: Gujarati Sweet Mithai
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 0 mins , Total Time: 10 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Mango Bhajiya recipe - How to make Mango Bhajiya
ingredients:
1 cup mango slices
 3/4 cup besan (bengal gram flour)
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 2 tsp chilli powder
 2 tsp coriander (dhania) seeds powder
 1 tsp green chilli paste
 1 tsp ginger (adrak) paste
 salt to taste
 oil for deep frying
recipe:
Method
Combine all the ingredients except mango pieces, mix well and make smooth flow batter adding enough water.
Heat the oil in a kadhai, add few mango pieces at a time and deep fry till they turn golden brown.
Drain on an absorbent paper and serve hot.
tags: Gujarati Farsans
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 10 mins, Total Time: 20 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Lemon Rice- South Special recipe - How to make Lemon Rice- South Special
ingredients:
300 gms cooked rice
 1/4 cup lemon juice
 3 whole dry kashmiri red chillies
 1/4 cup chana dal (split bengal gram)
 1/4 cup peanuts , optional
 1/4 cup cashewnuts (kaju) , optional
 15-20 curry leaves (kadi patta)
 1 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 1/2 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 1/2 tsp fennel seeds (saunf)
 1/2 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 1 tsp of turmeric powder (haldi)
 1/2 tsp chilli powder
 1/2 tsp ginger-garlic (adrak-lehsun) paste
 salt to taste
 1 tsp oil
recipe:
Method
In a vessel take the cooked rice and add the lemon juice and salt in it and mix well.
Heat oil in a non stick pan or wok.
Add the peanuts and cashewnuts and roast them for 2 minutes.
Keep aside the peanuts and cashews and add the chana dal in the pan and roast them for 2 to 3 minutes.
Add the cumin seeds,mustard seeds and fennel seeds and let it crackle.
Add 1/2 tsp of hing, dry red chilli and fry for 1 minute.
Add the curry leaves and haldi powder, chilli powder and mix well.
Add the ginger garlic paste and mix well till the rawness of the ginger garlic goes away.
Add the green peas and mix well.
Add the rice which was initially mixed with lemon and salt and mix well so that the masala is mixed completely and gives a nice bright lemon yellow color to the rice.
Finally add the roasted peanuts and cashews to the rice and give it a nice mix.
Serve with raita or a glass of chilled butter milk.
tags:
Gujarati One Dish Meal
South Indian Rice
Traditional Indian Rice Recipes
Quick Vegetarian Rice, khichdi Recipes
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 15 mins, Total Time: 30 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Dal Fry For Beginners. recipe - How to make Dal Fry For Beginners.
ingredients:
250 gms toovar (arhar) dal
 2 chopped tomatoes
 2 chopped onions
 2 chopped green chillies
 2 to 3 tsp chopped garlic (lehsun)
 2-3 whole dry kashmiri red chilli
 ghee for cooking
 1 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 1 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 1 cinnamon (dalchini) stick
 1 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1 tsp chilli powder
 1 tsp coriander (dhania) powder
 1 tsp cumin seeds (jeera) powder
 1/2 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 1 tsp garam masala
 1 tsp ginger-garlic (adrak-lehsun) paste
 salt to taste
 7 to 8 curry leaves (kadi patta)
 chopped coriander (dhania) for garnishing
recipe:
Method
Pressure cook the dal in 4 cups water for 3 whistles.
Allow the steam to escape before opening the lid and keep aside.
Heat the ghee in a non stick pan or wok.
Add the cumin seeds and mustard seeds and let it heat till they start to crackle.
Add the cinnamon stick and 1/2 tsp of hing.
Add the dry red chilli and curry leaves and saute for 20 seconds.
Add the chopped garlic and fry for 1 minute.
Add the onions and saute till the onions are golden brown.
Add the tomatoes and green chillies and cook till the tomatoes are pulpy and soft.
Add the ginger-garlic paste and saute well till the rawness of the ginger garlic paste goes away.
Add the haldi powder, red chilli powder, jeera powder, coriander powder and garam masala and saute for 3 to 4 minutes for the masalas to cook completely.
Once the tampering is done we add the pressure cooked dal in the pan.
Add salt and mix well and cook on a slow flame for about 5-6 minutes.
Garnish with coriander and serve.
tags:
Collection of Gujarati Dals / Kadhis
Bengali Dals / Curry
 Popular Dals from all over India
Quick Dals / quick Kadhis
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 15 mins, Total Time: 30 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Sweet Corn Khakra recipe - How to make Sweet Corn Khakra
ingredients:
1 1/2 cups whole wheat flour (gehun ka atta)
 1/2 cup maize flour (makai ka atta)
 1/2 cup boiled sweet corn kernels paste
 salt to taste
 2 tsp crushed cumin seeds
 2 tsp crushed peppercorns
 2 tbsp chopped fenugreek (methi) leaves
 2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1 tbsp oil
 oil for cooking
recipe:
Method
Combine all the ingredients in a deep bowl and knead a semi soft firm dough using enough water.
Roll 1 mm thin and 5" round khakra and roast it on a hot tava on a slow flame lightly with little oil on each side. This are 1/4 cooked. Keep aside.
Roast them again on a slow tava with the help of cloth, pressing it on all the sides. Roast it until brownish and crisp.
It will become crispier on cooling.
Serve it crisp with hot masala tea.
tags:
Gujarati  Dry Snacks
Breakfast Khakhras
Indian Travel Food Dry Snacks
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 15 mins, Total Time: 30 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Poha Aur Makai ka Upma recipe - How to make Poha Aur Makai ka Upma
ingredients:
1 cup beaten rice (poha)
 2 tbsp chopped cashewnuts (kaju)
 1 chopped onions
 1 cup crushed sweet corn kernels (makai ke dane)
 1/2 tbsp ginger-green chilli paste
 1/4 cup dessicated coconut
 1/2 tbsp sugar
 1 tsp lemon juice
 1 cup buttermilk
 2 tbsp ghee
 2 tsp urad dal (split black lentils)
 2 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 5-6 curry leaves (kadi patta)
 pinch asafoetida (hing)
 salt to taste
 chopped coriander (dhania) for garnishing
recipe:
Method
Roast poha in a pan and keep it aside.
Heat ghee in a pan and add urad dal and saute for 2-3 seconds.
Add the mustard seeds and when the seeds crackles, add asafoetida curry leaves and onions and saute for some time till onion gets transparent.
Add the cashewnuts and sweetcorn and saute for 7-8 minutes.
Add the butter milk and 1 to 2 cup of water and stir continuously.
When it starts boiling add roasted poha, ginger-green chilli paste, coconut, sugar and mix well.
Add lemon juice and mix well.
Garnish with sev and coriander and serve hot.
tags:
Gujarati One Dish Meal
Breakfast Upma, Poha
Quick Breakfast Indian
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 20 mins, Total Time: 35 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Thandi Thandai recipe - How to make Thandi Thandai
ingredients:
500 ml milk
 2 tsp rose syrup
 2 tbsp sugar
 For The Thandai Mixture:
 1 tbsp poppy seeds (khus-khus)
 4 cashewnuts (kaju)
 2 tsp roasted fennel seeds (saunf)
 4 almonds (badam)
 7 peppercorns (kalimirch)
 4 cardamoms
 a few saffron (kesar) strands
recipe:
Method
Grind the thandai mixture to fine powder and keep aside.
Bring milk to boil. Add the above mixture and simmer for 2 minutes. Add sugar and let it dissolve well. Add rose syrup and stir well. Sieve the milk.
Refrigerate for few hours and serve fresh and cold.
tags:
Gujarati  Drinks
Indian Drinks / Sharbats
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 0 mins , Total Time: 10 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Khata Achhar recipe - How to make Khata Achhar
ingredients:
1/2 cup kabuli chana (white chick peas)
 1 1/2 cups grated raw mangoes
 1 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1 tbsp fenugreek (methi) seeds
 1 tbsp fenugreek seeds (methi) powder
 1 tbsp fennel seeds (saunf)
 1/2 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 1 tsp nigella seeds (kalonji)
 14 whole dry kashmiri red chillies
 1 tbsp chilli powder
 1 1/4 cups mustard (rai / sarson) oil
 1 tbsp salt
recipe:
Method
Combine the grated mango, turmeric powder and salt and leave aside for 30 minutes.  Squeeze out all the mango water using a muslim cloth and keep aside. Keep the grated mango aside separately.
Soak the kabuli chana and fenugreek seeds in the mango water overnight.
Refrigerate the grated mango.
Combine the fenugreek seeds powder, fennel seeds, asafoetida, nigella seeds, whole red chillies, chilli powder and soaked kabuli chana mixture with the grated mango. Mix well.
Heat the mustard oil. Cool it and add to the prepared mixture.
Bottle the pickle in a sterilised glass jar.  The pickle is ready to eat after 3 to 4 days.
Store it a cool dry place for upto 1 year.
tags:
Punjabi Raita | Punjabi  Chutney | Achar 
Gujarati Kachumber / Chutneys / Achar
times: Preparation Time: 24 hrs, Total Time: 24 hours,     Cooking Time: 3 days

recipe_long_name: Papad in Curd Curry recipe - How to make Papad in Curd Curry
ingredients:
3 to 4 papad
 1 cup curds (dahi)
 1 tbsp oil
 1/2 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 1/4 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 1/4 tsp chilli powder
 1/2 tsp coriander (dhania) powder
 salt to taste
recipe:
Method
Roast the papads and keep them aside.
Now in a small bowl put the turmeric, red chilli and coriander powder and some water and mix well to form a liquid paste.
Now in a cooking pan, heat some oil and add the cumin seeds.
Once the seeds splatter add the paste and fry it till the paste leaves oil.
Add the water and let it boil and once the curry comes to boil, crush the papads into medium pieces and add it to the curry.
Let it boil it for 2 minutes.
Now beat the yogurt into a smooth consistency and add it to the curry.
Add salt and while stirring continuously let the curry boil for 3-4 min.
Serve hot.
tags:
Rajasthani Kadhi, Dal
Collection of Gujarati Dals / Kadhis
times: Preparation Time: 2 mins, Cooking Time: 5 mins, Total Time: 7 mins ,
